hypothesis_content.title: High-Frequency Mean Reversion on 15-Minute Volume Spikes
hypothesis_content.statement: In NEUTRAL regimes, when BTC experiences a 15-minute volume spike > 2.5x 20-period average accompanied by a price move > 1.5% in either direction, price will revert 50% of that move within the next 90 minutes with >58% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes lack sustained directional momentum. Large volume spikes often represent liquidation events or overreactions that get partially retraced as liquidity normalizes and high-frequency market makers fade extremes.
entry_conditions: Absolute price change > 1.5% within same 15min candle
Entry at close of spike candle in opposite direction of spike

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price extends another 0.75% beyond spike extreme

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Win rate < 52% OR more than 35% of signals result in continuation rather than reversion. Particularly fails during news-driven spikes that change market structure.
